Add notes explaining how to use the module via the Origami build service - fixes #243 and #294

Wrap whole lib in IIFE to circumvent problems with eval-based devtools

It fixes a problem when fastclick is used with a bundler like browserify or webpack which
use eval() for source urls.

According to the documentation on eval() in strict mode "strict" code can only access
variables defined by eval() in the same scope. Thus accessing FastClick or deviceIsAndroid
inside of a function (which is preceded by 'use strict') triggers a ReferenceError.

https://github.com/ftlabs/fastclick/pull/233#issuecomment-38866675

Fix explanation of when focusing is allowed

Nitpick, but triggering programmatic events calls event handlers
synchronously, and can focus things fine, the problem demonstrated in
this example page is that (in Safari on iOS < 5) touchend event handlers
just can't focus things. Here's a page with more discriminatory test
cases:
http://jsbin.com/gixaduni/2

Conflicts:
	lib/fastclick.js
Prevent NRE after manual re-detecting the targetElement on iOS
Update README.md with basic usage info for browserify/commonjs.

Fix for regression introduced by #57 (fling scroll sends click, re-fixes #42)

Starting from 0.5.1 (first version to include #57 fix), the bug fixed by #42 reappeared: tapping on a currently scrolling container with -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch sends a click on the underlying element (iOS 6); the expected behavior on iOS would be to just stop scrolling and not fire a click.

I haven't had much time to read through and understand the code (so the change may have side effects) but it restores the behavior of 0.5.0. So please consider this a bug report and adjust as needed.
Make touch boundary a settable property (issue #112)
FastClick not needed when -ms-touch-action is set to none on the layer
Set minified file as a target
Add note on Chrome on Android
select and textarea elements can also be disabled

Merge pull request #105 from wilsonpage/master

This was complaining when our project linter was being run over it
Trim whitespace to pass labs linter
Ensure FastClick is explicitly added to window if no module system is being used (fixes #96)
Should check if the needsclick class is present on input and buttons (fixes #92)
Add note explaining why there are no automated tests (issue #95)
Chrome with user-scalable=no doesn't need FastClick (issue #15)

Ignore tests and examples dirs

Bower wont pull in files and directories listed in the 'ignore' array.
Touchend event comes after click event now
Don't send click after a setTimeout as that prevents focusing from a callback (issue #82)
Fix for issue #84. Allowing tap events on read-only input fields.
Add reduced test case for issue #83

fix component install

"It is recommended that you use "index.js" for the main component file, however if you use another filename, you MUST define a "main" field for that. A component MUST have only one "main" file specified, and it MUST still be listed in the "scripts" array."
Correct outdated comments (uses of flags have changed)
Add links to explanations in French, Japanese and Russian
Fix #75: only unset target element if click is not permitted
Remove synthesis of mouseup/down/over events for now
Android 2.2 needs FastClick to be instantiated before the other listeners so that the stopImmediatePropagation hack can work
Return value wasn't being returned by instance methods
Merge logic in onClick and onMouse into one method and put onMouse listeners behind Android flag
send mouseover, mousedown, and mouseup events
undo setActive (has a lot of issues)
queue sendClick instead of direct call (guarantee click event will be processed after touchend)
revert focus change in simulated click
Add button tag to disabled check logic
Add workaround for file inputs on iOS (fixes issue #68)

Add script to build minified library (fix #66)
- run bin/minify from the project root
- minified version is outputted to build/fastclick.min.js
Add test case for issue #60 showing that pointer-events: none works

Work around incorrect element detection on iOS 6 in transitioning/scrolling layers (fixes #57)

iOS 6.0 (and potentially beyond) has a bug where event.target gives an
incorrect element if that element is within a parent that is currently
being scrolled or CSS transitioned.  This works around the problem by
performing manual detection in these circumstanced by using
document.elementFromPoint with coordinates derived from the event,
which works if preceded by an event.target.
On some older browsers event.target may be a text node (fixes #56)
Fix for incorrectly sending click when a tap is used to stop a fling scroll on a layer made scrollable using -webkit-overflow-scrolling: touch (fixes issue #42)
- Add stats collection and output to layer example (fixes #40)
Send selection to end on iOS (fixes #43)
Only trusted events will deselect text on iOS (fixes issue #49)

- Fix a regression of issue #23 expect for Safari on iOS 4
- Safari on iOS4 sometimes sends the same identifier twice in a row, intermittently breaking clicking because of the workaround for issue #23, therefore disable the workaround for that platform pending a proper fix, fixing issue #52
Add reduced test case for issue #51
Create reduced test case for issue #37
Fix for issue #37, which is caused by a browser bug in Mobile Safari
Update issue number and add link to index

Fixes issue #23:
On iOS (at least 5 and 6), when the user next taps anywhere else on the page, new touchstart and touchend events are dispatched with the same identifier as the touch event that previously triggered the click that triggered the alert.
Check in case addEventListener was called twice with the same function
Allow listeners to be removed on Android 2
- Deal with warnings emitted by Closure Compiler in advanced mode
Rationalize maybeSendClick into needsClick and sendClick
Add note on Component and NPM
Added test case for issue #37 (Thanks to @rajushank84)
fixed an improperly prevented default in onTouchStart

stemming from issue 36, double-clicking a field created some unusual behavior in iOS (test-able using the same jsfiddle). Prevented default bevior on touchstart to guard against phantom clicks on double-click
lowered the threshold for held click-events to further prevent behavior
Add fix for issue #36. The solution isn't ideal and requires a nasty workaround where we guess whether a click event is going to be fired if the touch started more than 150ms ago.

fixes "failed to require "fastclick" from (...)"

From the component/component wiki:

"It is recommended that you use "index.js" for the main component file, however if you use another filename, you MUST define a "main" field for that. A component MUST have only one "main" file specified, and it MUST still be listed in the "scripts" array."
Support fast focusing of labelled controls by descendancy (fixes #30)
Make touch listeners bubbling rather than capturing. This allows other libraries, like ftscroller, to handle touch interactions at a lower level.
Conform to FT Labs coding standards
Should be checking deviceIsAndroid instead of android (#24)
Remove usused textarea style from example

Very odd behaviour on iOS (issue #18): if a submit element is present inside a form and the user hits enter in the iOS simulator or clicks the Go button on the pop-up OS keyboard the a kind of 'fake' click event will be triggered with the submit-type input element as the target.
Add a routine to check if a touch has moved between touchstart and touchmove. This prevents ghost clicks when a layer has been scrolled or translated.
Default needs to be prevent when triggering focus on touchend, except for select elements
Refactor to declare functions on prototype. Bumping version to 0.3.0.

Big refactor to use event.target instead of coordinates and elementFromPoint
- fixes #18 for unknown reasons
- fixes #6 becauses we no longer need to detect zoom/pixel ratio (phew!)
Add index files for tests and examples
Add button that only be reached by scrolling to test screen coordinates when zoomed (#6)
Amend package description and move source files into lib/
Added package.json for easier use with npm
Add comments and short circuit for Playbook detection
Alerts tend to mess up event order
Add special cases for input types that don't need focus

Fix labels (and make them fast!) for checkboxes on iOS 4, though labels for input type=text still doesn't work on that OS
Fix labels for text inputs and checkboxes on Android browser and Chrome on Android (4.0)
Select elements on iOS 4 require default to _not_ be prevented otherwise the element will focus but not open

FastFocus changes
- FastClick was never being instantiated on the input.html example because the 'load' event fires on the window, not on the document
- Change the example text to reflect the new behaviour (clicks aren't fired but focus is achieved without a delay on iOS >= 5

Added a hack that bypasses the need to click on inpout elements.

Instead the focus() method is called on the input element instantly.
(This code needs reviewing!)
Add note on AMD support to README
Style changes and add global declaration for jsh/lint
Whoops, needs a function around the callback
Use a switch instead of a map
On Chrome for Android, amend coordinates by the device pixel ratio
Fix weird onclick attribute issue in Android browser (fixes #2)
Add note on Closure Compiler, add minified version, don't force exposure
Support advanced compilation with Closure Compiler (fixes #1)
Move credits to bottom of readme
